intro: Triodia basedowii, commonly known as the spinifex grass, is a hardy, perennial grass native to Australia. It is characterized by its dense, spiky foliage and is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The plant forms extensive, low-growing tussocks that help stabilize soil and prevent erosion. Its leaves are typically covered in fine, stiff hairs that reduce water loss and protect against herbivory. Triodia basedowii plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing shelter and food for various desert fauna.
